00055 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL

00057 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-helper.h>

00074 /* Use full LMTDMA when PARAMETER_CHECKINS is enabled */
00075 #undef  CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING
00076 #define CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING 0
00077 
00078 /* dwords count from 1-16 */
00079 /* scratch line for LMT operations */
00080 /* Should be unique wrt other uses of CVMSEG, e.g. IOBDMA */
00081 #define CVMX_PKO_LMTLINE 2ull
00082 
00083 /* PKO3 queue level identifier */
00084 enum cvmx_pko3_level_e {
00085     CVMX_PKO_LEVEL_INVAL = 0,
00086     CVMX_PKO_PORT_QUEUES = 0xd1,
00087     CVMX_PKO_L2_QUEUES = 0xc2,
00088     CVMX_PKO_L3_QUEUES = 0xb3,
00089     CVMX_PKO_L4_QUEUES = 0xa4,
00090     CVMX_PKO_L5_QUEUES = 0x95,
00091     CVMX_PKO_DESCR_QUEUES = 0x86,
00092 };
00093 
00094 
00095 enum cvmx_pko_dqop {
00096     CVMX_PKO_DQ_SEND = 0ULL,
00097     CVMX_PKO_DQ_OPEN = 1ULL,
00098     CVMX_PKO_DQ_CLOSE = 2ULL,
00099     CVMX_PKO_DQ_QUERY = 3ULL
00100 };
00101 
00102 /**
00103  * Returns the PKO DQ..L2 Shaper Time-Wheel clock rate for specified node.
00104  */
00105 static inline
00106 uint64_t cvmx_pko3_dq_tw_clock_rate_node(int node)
00107 {
00108     return cvmx_clock_get_rate_node(node, CVMX_CLOCK_SCLK) / 768;
00109 }
00110 
00111 /**
00112  * Returns the PKO Port Shaper Time-Wheel clock rate for specified node.
00113  */
00114 static inline
00115 uint64_t cvmx_pko3_pq_tw_clock_rate_node(int node)
00116 {
00117     int div;
00118 
00119     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00120         div = 96;
00121     else
00122         div = 48;
00123     return cvmx_clock_get_rate_node(node, CVMX_CLOCK_SCLK) / div;
00124 }
00125 
00126 /**
00127  * @INTERNAL
00128  * Return the number of MACs in the PKO (exclusing the NULL MAC)
00129  * in a model-dependent manner.
00130  */
00131 static inline unsigned __cvmx_pko3_num_macs(void)
00132 {
00133         if(OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX))
00134         return 10;
00135         if(OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX))
00136         return 14;
00137         if(OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00138         return 28;
00139     return 0;
00140 }
00141 
00142 /**
00143  * @INTERNAL
00144  * Return the number of queue levels, depending on SoC model
00145  */
00146 static inline int __cvmx_pko3_sq_lvl_max(void)
00147 {
00148         if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX))
00149         return CVMX_PKO_L3_QUEUES;
00150         if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX))
00151         return CVMX_PKO_L3_QUEUES;
00152         if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX))
00153         return CVMX_PKO_L5_QUEUES;
00154     return -1;
00155 }
00156 
00157 /**
00158  * @INTERNAL
00159  * Return the next (lower) queue level for a given level
00160  */
00161 static inline enum cvmx_pko3_level_e
00162 __cvmx_pko3_sq_lvl_next(enum cvmx_pko3_level_e level)
00163 {
00164     switch(level) {
00165         default:
00166             return CVMX_PKO_LEVEL_INVAL;
00167         case CVMX_PKO_PORT_QUEUES:
00168             return CVMX_PKO_L2_QUEUES;
00169         case CVMX_PKO_L2_QUEUES:
00170             return CVMX_PKO_L3_QUEUES;
00171         case CVMX_PKO_L3_QUEUES:
00172             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) ||
00173                 OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX))
00174                 return CVMX_PKO_DESCR_QUEUES;
00175             return CVMX_PKO_L4_QUEUES;
00176         case CVMX_PKO_L4_QUEUES:
00177             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) ||
00178                 OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX))
00179                 return CVMX_PKO_LEVEL_INVAL;
00180             return CVMX_PKO_L5_QUEUES;
00181         case CVMX_PKO_L5_QUEUES:
00182             if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) ||
00183                 OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX))
00184                 return CVMX_PKO_LEVEL_INVAL;
00185             return CVMX_PKO_DESCR_QUEUES;
00186     }
00187 }
00188 
00189 /**
00190  * @INTERNAL
00191  * Return an SQ identifier string, for debug messages.
00192  */
00193 static inline char *
00194 __cvmx_pko3_sq_str(char * buf, enum cvmx_pko3_level_e level, unsigned q)
00195 {
00196     char *p;
00197 
00198     switch(level) {
00199         default:
00200             strcpy(buf, "ERR-SQ/");
00201             break;
00202         case CVMX_PKO_PORT_QUEUES:
00203             strcpy(buf, "PQ_L1/");
00204             break;
00205         case CVMX_PKO_L2_QUEUES:
00206             strcpy(buf, "SQ_L2/");
00207             break;
00208         case CVMX_PKO_L3_QUEUES:
00209             strcpy(buf, "SQ_L3/");
00210             break;
00211         case CVMX_PKO_L4_QUEUES:
00212             strcpy(buf, "SQ_L4/");
00213             break;
00214         case CVMX_PKO_L5_QUEUES:
00215             strcpy(buf, "SQ_L5/");
00216             break;
00217         case CVMX_PKO_DESCR_QUEUES:
00218             strcpy(buf, "DQ/");
00219             break;
00220     }
00221 
00222     for(p=buf; *p; p++)
00223         ;
00224     *p++ = '0' + q / 1000;
00225     q -= (q / 1000) * 1000;
00226     *p++ = '0' + q / 100;
00227     q -= (q / 100) * 100;
00228     *p++ = '0' + q / 10;
00229     q -= (q / 10) * 10;
00230     *p++ = '0' + q;
00231     *p++ = ':';
00232     *p++ = '\0';
00233     return buf;
00234 }
00235 
00236 
00237 union cvmx_pko_query_rtn {
00238     uint64_t u64;
00239     struct {
00240         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t dqstatus   : 4,
00241         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_50_59 :10,
00242         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t dqop   : 2,
00243         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t depth  :48,
00244             ))));
00245     } s;
00246 };
00247 typedef union cvmx_pko_query_rtn cvmx_pko_query_rtn_t;
00248 
00249 /* PKO_QUERY_RTN_S[DQSTATUS] - cvmx_pko_query_rtn_t->s.dqstatus */
00250 enum pko_query_dqstatus {
00251     PKO_DQSTATUS_PASS = 0,      /* No error */
00252     PKO_DQSTATUS_BADSTATE = 0x8,    /* queue was not ready to enqueue */
00253     PKO_DQSTATUS_NOFPABUF = 0x9,    /* FPA out of buffers */
00254     PKO_DQSTATUS_NOPKOBUF = 0xA,    /* PKO out of buffers */
00255     PKO_DQSTATUS_FAILRTNPTR = 0xB,  /* can't return buffer ptr to FPA */
00256     PKO_DQSTATUS_ALREADY = 0xC, /* already created */
00257     PKO_DQSTATUS_NOTCREATED = 0xD,  /* not created */
00258     PKO_DQSTATUS_NOTEMPTY = 0xE,    /* queue not empty */
00259     PKO_DQSTATUS_SENDPKTDROP = 0xF  /* packet dropped, illegal construct */
00260 };
00261 typedef enum pko_query_dqstatus pko_query_dqstatus_t;
00262 
00263 /* Sub-command three bit codes (SUBDC3) */
00264 #define CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_LINK     0x0
00265 #define CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_GATHER   0x1
00266 #define CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_JUMP     0x2
00267 /* Sub-command four bit codes (SUBDC4) */
00268 #define CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_TSO      0x8
00269 #define CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_FREE     0x9
00270 #define CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_WORK     0xA
00271 #define CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_AURA     0xB
00272 #define CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_MEM      0xC
00273 #define CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_EXT      0xD
00274 #define CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_CRC      0xE
00275 #define CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_IMM      0xF
00276 
00277 /**
00278  * pko buf ptr
00279  * This is good for LINK_S, GATHER_S and PKI_BUFLINK_S structure use.
00280  * It can also be used for JUMP_S with F-bit represented by "i" field,
00281  * and the size limited to 8-bit.
00282 */
00283 
00284 union cvmx_pko_buf_ptr {
00285     uint64_t u64;
00286     struct {
00287         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t size   :16,
00288         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t subdc3 : 3,
00289         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t i      : 1,
00290         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_42_43 : 2,
00291         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t addr   :42,
00292             )))));
00293     } s;
00294 };
00295 typedef union cvmx_pko_buf_ptr cvmx_pko_buf_ptr_t;
00296 
00297 /**
00298  * pko_auraalg_e
00299  */
00300 enum pko_auraalg_e {
00301     AURAALG_NOP = 0x0,  /* aura_cnt = No change */
00302     AURAALG_SUB = 0x3,  /* aura_cnt -= pko_send_aura_t.offset */
00303     AURAALG_SUBLEN = 0x7,   /* aura_cnt -= pko_send_aura_t.offset +
00304                         pko_send_hdr_t.total_bytes */
00305     AURAALG_SUBMBUF = 0xB   /* aura_cnt -= pko_send_aura_t.offset +
00306                         mbufs_freed */
00307 };
00308 
00309 /**
00310  * PKO_CKL4ALG_E
00311  */
00312 enum pko_clk4alg_e {
00313     CKL4ALG_NONE = 0x0, /* No checksum. */
00314     CKL4ALG_UDP = 0x1,  /* UDP L4 checksum. */
00315     CKL4ALG_TCP = 0x2,  /* TCP L4 checksum. */
00316     CKL4ALG_SCTP = 0x3, /* SCTP L4 checksum. */
00317 };
00318 
00319 /**
00320  * pko_send_aura
00321  */
00322 union cvmx_pko_send_aura {
00323     uint64_t u64;
00324     struct {
00325                 CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_60_63 : 4,
00326                 CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t aura   : 12, /* NODE+LAURA */
00327                 CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t subdc4     : 4,
00328                 CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t alg    : 4, /* pko_auraalg_e */
00329                 CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_08_39 : 32,
00330                 CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t offset     : 8,
00331             ))))));
00332     } s;
00333 };
00334 typedef union cvmx_pko_send_aura cvmx_pko_send_aura_t;
00335 
00336 /**
00337  * pko_send_tso
00338  */
00339 union cvmx_pko_send_tso {
00340     uint64_t u64;
00341     struct {
00342         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t l2len  : 8,
00343         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_48_55 : 8,
00344         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t subdc4 : 4, /* 0x8 */
00345         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_32_43 : 12,
00346         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t sb     : 8,
00347         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t mss    : 16,
00348         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t eom    : 1,
00349         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t fn     : 7,
00350             ))))))));
00351     } s;
00352 };
00353 typedef union cvmx_pko_send_tso cvmx_pko_send_tso_t;
00354 
00355 /**
00356  * pko_send_free
00357  */
00358 union cvmx_pko_send_free {
00359     uint64_t u64;
00360     struct {
00361                 CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_48_63 : 16,
00362                 CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t subdc4 : 4, /* 0x9 */
00363                 CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd   : 2,
00364                 CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t addr   : 42,
00365             ))));
00366     } s;
00367 };
00368 typedef union cvmx_pko_send_free cvmx_pko_send_free_t;
00369 
00370 /* PKO_SEND_HDR_S - PKO header subcommand */
00371 union cvmx_pko_send_hdr {
00372     uint64_t u64;
00373     struct {
00374         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_60_63 :4,
00375         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t aura   :12,
00376         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t ckl4   :2, /* PKO_CKL4ALG_E */
00377         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t ckl3   :1,
00378         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t ds     :1,
00379         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t le     :1,
00380         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t n2     :1,
00381         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t ii     :1,
00382         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t df     :1,
00383         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_39    :1,
00384         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t format :7,
00385         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t l4ptr  :8,
00386         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t l3ptr  :8,
00387         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t total  :16,
00388             ))))))))))))));
00389     } s;
00390 };
00391 typedef union cvmx_pko_send_hdr cvmx_pko_send_hdr_t;
00392 
00393 /* PKO_SEND_EXT_S - extended header subcommand */
00394 union cvmx_pko_send_ext {
00395     uint64_t u64;
00396     struct {
00397         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_48_63 :16,
00398         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t subdc4 :4, /* _SENDSUBDC_EXT */
00399         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t col    :2, /* _COLORALG_E */
00400         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t ra     :2, /* _REDALG_E */
00401         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t tstmp  :1,
00402         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_24_38:15,
00403         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t markptr    :8,
00404         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_9_15  :7,
00405         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t shapechg   :9,
00406             )))))))));
00407     } s;
00408 };
00409 typedef union cvmx_pko_send_ext cvmx_pko_send_ext_t;
00410 
00411 /* PKO_MEMDSZ_E */
00412 enum cvmx_pko_memdsz_e {
00413     MEMDSZ_B64 = 0,
00414     MEMDSZ_B32 = 1,
00415     MEMDSZ_B16 = 2,     /* Not in HRM, assumed unsupported */
00416     MEMDSZ_B8 = 3
00417 };
00418 
00419 /* PKO_MEMALG_E */
00420 enum cvmx_pko_memalg_e {
00421     MEMALG_SET = 0,     /* Set mem = PKO_SEND_MEM_S[OFFSET] */
00422     MEMALG_SETTSTMP = 1,    /* Set the memory location to the timestamp
00423                    PKO_SEND_MEM_S[DSZ] must be B64 and a
00424                    PKO_SEND_EXT_S subdescriptor must be in
00425                    the descriptor with PKO_SEND_EXT_S[TSTMP]=1
00426                  */
00427     MEMALG_SETRSLT = 2, /* [DSZ] = B64; mem = PKO_MEM_RESULT_S.  */
00428     MEMALG_ADD = 8,     /* mem = mem + PKO_SEND_MEM_S[OFFSET] */
00429     MEMALG_SUB = 9,     /* mem = mem – PKO_SEND_MEM_S[OFFSET] */
00430     MEMALG_ADDLEN = 0xA,    /* mem += [OFFSET] + PKO_SEND_HDR_S[TOTAL] */
00431     MEMALG_SUBLEN = 0xB,    /* mem -= [OFFSET] + PKO_SEND_HDR_S[TOTAL] */
00432     MEMALG_ADDMBUF = 0xC,   /* mem += [OFFSET] + mbufs_freed */
00433     MEMALG_SUBMBUF = 0xD    /* mem -= [OFFSET] + mbufs_freed */
00434 };
00435 
00436 union cvmx_pko_send_mem {
00437     uint64_t u64;
00438     struct {
00439         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_63    :1,
00440         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t wmem   :1,
00441         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t dsz    :2, /* PKO_MEMDSZ_E */
00442         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t alg    :4, /* PKO_MEMALG_E */
00443         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t offset :8,
00444         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t subdc4 :4,
00445         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_42_43 :2,
00446         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t addr   :42,
00447         ))))))));
00448     } s;
00449 };
00450

00458         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t tt     :2,
00459         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_48_49 :2,
00460         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t subdc4 :4,
00461         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_42_43 :2,

00469 /*** PKO_SEND_DMA_S - format of IOBDMA/LMTDMA data word ***/
00470 union cvmx_pko_lmtdma_data {
00471     uint64_t u64;
00472     struct {
00473         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t scraddr    : 8,
00474         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rtnlen : 8,
00475         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did    : 8, /* 0x51 */
00476         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t node   : 4,
00477         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_34_35 : 2,
00478         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t dqop   : 2, /* PKO_DQOP_E */
00479         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_26_31 : 6,
00480         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t dq     : 10,
00481         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t rsvd_0_15  : 16,
00482             )))))))));
00483     } s;
00484 };
00485 typedef union cvmx_pko_lmtdma_data cvmx_pko_lmtdma_data_t;
00486 
00487 typedef struct cvmx_pko3_dq_params_s {
00488 #ifdef __LITTLE_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00489     int32_t limit;
00490     int32_t depth;
00491 #else
00492     int32_t depth;
00493     int32_t limit;
00494 #endif
00495     uint64_t pad[15];
00496 } cvmx_pko3_dq_params_t;
00497 
00498 /* DQ depth cached value */
00499 extern CVMX_SHARED
00500 cvmx_pko3_dq_params_t  *__cvmx_pko3_dq_params[CVMX_MAX_NODES];
00501 
00502 
00503 extern int cvmx_pko3_internal_buffer_count(unsigned node);
00504 
00505 /**
00506  * @INTERNAL
00507  * PKO3 DQ parameter location
00508  * @param node      node
00509  * @param dq        dq
00510  */
00511 static inline cvmx_pko3_dq_params_t *
00512 cvmx_pko3_dq_parameters(unsigned node, unsigned dq)
00513 {
00514     cvmx_pko3_dq_params_t *pParam = NULL;
00515     static cvmx_pko3_dq_params_t dummy;
00516     dummy.depth = 0;
00517     dummy.limit = (1<<16);
00518 
00519     if (cvmx_likely(node < CVMX_MAX_NODES))
00520         pParam = __cvmx_pko3_dq_params[node];
00521 
00522     if (cvmx_likely(pParam != NULL))
00523         pParam += dq;
00524     else
00525         pParam = &dummy;
00526 
00527     return pParam;
00528 }
00529 
00530 static inline void cvmx_pko3_dq_set_limit(unsigned node, unsigned dq,
00531     unsigned limit)
00532 {
00533     cvmx_pko3_dq_params_t *pParam;
00534     pParam = cvmx_pko3_dq_parameters(node, dq);
00535     pParam->limit = limit;
00536 }
00537 
00538 /**
00539  * PKO descriptor queue operation error string
00540  *
00541  * @param dqstatus is the enumeration returned from hardware,
00542  *    PKO_QUERY_RTN_S[DQSTATUS].
00543  *
00544  * @return static constant string error description
00545  */
00546 const char * pko_dqstatus_error(pko_query_dqstatus_t dqstatus);
00547 
00548 
00549 /*
00550  * This function gets PKO mac num for a interface/port.
00551  *
00552  * @param interface is the interface number.
00553  * @param index is the port number.
00554  * @return returns mac number if successful or -1 on failure.
00555  */
00556 static inline int __cvmx_pko3_get_mac_num(int xiface, int index)
00557 {
00558     struct cvmx_xiface xi = cvmx_helper_xiface_to_node_interface(xiface);
00559     cvmx_helper_interface_mode_t mode;
00560     int interface_index;
00561     int ilk_mac_base = -1, bgx_mac_base = -1, bgx_ports = 4;
00562 
00563     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX)) {
00564         bgx_mac_base = 2;
00565     }
00566 
00567     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX)) {
00568         bgx_mac_base = 2;
00569     }
00570 
00571         if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX)) {
00572         ilk_mac_base = 2;
00573         bgx_mac_base = 4;
00574     }
00575 
00576     mode = cvmx_helper_interface_get_mode(xiface);
00577     switch (mode) {
00578         case CVMX_HELPER_INTERFACE_MODE_LOOP:
00579             return 0;
00580         case CVMX_HELPER_INTERFACE_MODE_NPI:
00581             return 1;
00582         case CVMX_HELPER_INTERFACE_MODE_ILK:
00583             if (ilk_mac_base < 0)
00584                 return -1;
00585             interface_index = (xi.interface - CVMX_ILK_GBL_BASE());
00586             if (interface_index < 0)
00587                 return -1;
00588             return (ilk_mac_base + interface_index);
00589         case CVMX_HELPER_INTERFACE_MODE_SRIO:
00590             return (4 + 2 * xi.interface + index);
00591         default:
00592             if (xi.interface >= CVMX_ILK_GBL_BASE() &&
00593                 ilk_mac_base >= 0)
00594                 return -1;
00595             /* All other modes belong to BGX */
00596             return (bgx_mac_base +
00597                 bgx_ports * xi.interface + index);
00598     }
00599 }
00600 
00601 /**
00602  * @INTERNAL
00603  *
00604  * Get scratch offset for LMTDMA/LMTST data buffer
00605  *
00606  */
00607 static inline unsigned
00608 cvmx_pko3_lmtdma_scr_base(void)
00609 {
00610     return CVMX_PKO_LMTLINE * CVMX_CACHE_LINE_SIZE;
00611 }
00612 
00613 /**
00614  * @INTERNAL
00615  *
00616  * Get address for LMTDMA/LMTST data buffer
00617  *
00618  */
00619 static inline uint64_t *
00620 cvmx_pko3_cvmseg_addr(void)
00621 {
00622     const unsigned scr = CVMX_PKO_LMTLINE * CVMX_CACHE_LINE_SIZE;
00623     return (uint64_t *) (CVMX_SCRATCH_BASE + scr);
00624 }
00625 
00626 
00627 /**
00628  * Save scratchpad area
00629  * @param buf storage buffer for saving previous scratchpad contents.
00630  *
00631  * This function should be used whenever the cache line is used
00632  * from a context that might preempt another context that too uses
00633  * the same cache line designated for LMTST/LMTDMA and Wide-Atomic
00634  * operations, such as the hard interrupt context in Linux kernel,
00635  * that could preempt a user-space application on the same processor
00636  * core also using the same scratchpad.
00637  * 'cvmx_lmtline_save()' should be called upon entry into the
00638  * potentially interrupting context, and 'cvmx_lmtline_restore()' should
00639  * be called prior to exitting that context.
00640  */
00641 static inline void cvmx_lmtline_save(uint64_t buf[16])
00642 {
00643     unsigned i, scr_off = cvmx_pko3_lmtdma_scr_base();
00644     unsigned sz = CVMX_CACHE_LINE_SIZE/sizeof(uint64_t);
00645 
00646     /* wait LMTDMA to finish (if any) */
00647     CVMX_SYNCIOBDMA;
00648 
00649     /* Copy LMTLINE to user-provided buffer */
00650     for (i = 0; i < sz; i++)
00651         buf[i] = cvmx_scratch_read64(scr_off + i * sizeof(uint64_t));
00652 }
00653 
00654 /**
00655  * Restore scratchpad area
00656  * @param buf storage buffer containing the previous content of scratchpad.
00657  */
00658 static inline void cvmx_lmtline_restore(const uint64_t buf[16])
00659 {
00660     unsigned i, scr_off = cvmx_pko3_lmtdma_scr_base();
00661     unsigned sz = CVMX_CACHE_LINE_SIZE/sizeof(uint64_t);
00662 
00663     /* wait LMTDMA to finsh (if any) */
00664     CVMX_SYNCIOBDMA;
00665 
00666     /* restore scratchpad area from buf[] */
00667     for (i = 0; i < sz; i++)
00668         cvmx_scratch_write64(scr_off + i * sizeof(uint64_t), buf[i]);
00669 }
00670 
00671 /*
00672  * @INTERNAL
00673  * Deliver PKO SEND commands via CVMSEG LM and LMTDMA/LMTST.
00674  * The command should be already stored in the CVMSEG address.
00675  *
00676  * @param node is the destination node
00677  * @param dq is the destination descriptor queue.
00678  * @param numwords is the number of outgoing words
00679  * @param tag_wait Wait to finish tag switch just before issueing LMTDMA
00680  * @return the PKO3 native query result structure.
00681  *
00682  * <numwords> must be between 1 and 15 for CVMX_PKO_DQ_SEND command
00683  *
00684  * NOTE: Internal use only.
00685  */
00686 static inline cvmx_pko_query_rtn_t
00687 __cvmx_pko3_lmtdma(uint8_t node, uint16_t dq, unsigned numwords, bool tag_wait)
00688 {
00689     const enum cvmx_pko_dqop dqop = CVMX_PKO_DQ_SEND;
00690     cvmx_pko_query_rtn_t pko_status;
00691     cvmx_pko_lmtdma_data_t pko_send_dma_data;
00692     uint64_t dma_addr;
00693     unsigned scr_base = cvmx_pko3_lmtdma_scr_base();
00694     unsigned scr_off;
00695     cvmx_pko3_dq_params_t *pParam;
00696 
00697     if (cvmx_unlikely(numwords < 1 || numwords > 15)) {
00698         cvmx_dprintf("%s: ERROR: Internal error\n",
00699                 __FUNCTION__);
00700         pko_status.u64 = ~0ull;
00701         return pko_status;
00702     }
00703 
00704     pParam = cvmx_pko3_dq_parameters(node, dq);
00705 
00706     pko_status.u64 = 0;
00707     pko_send_dma_data.u64 = 0;
00708 
00709     /* LMTDMA address offset is (nWords-1) */
00710     dma_addr = CVMX_LMTDMA_ORDERED_IO_ADDR;
00711     dma_addr += (numwords - 1) << 3;
00712 
00713     scr_off = scr_base + numwords * sizeof(uint64_t);
00714 
00715     /* Write all-ones into the return area */
00716     cvmx_scratch_write64(scr_off, ~0ull);
00717 
00718     /* Barrier: make sure all prior writes complete before the following */
00719     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00720 
00721     /* If cached depth exceeds limit, check the real depth */
00722     if (cvmx_unlikely(pParam->depth > pParam->limit)) {
00723         cvmx_pko_dqx_wm_cnt_t wm_cnt;
00724         wm_cnt.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node,CVMX_PKO_DQX_WM_CNT(dq));
00725         pParam->depth = pko_status.s.depth = wm_cnt.s.count;
00726 
00727         if (pParam->depth > pParam->limit) {
00728             pko_status.s.dqop = dqop;
00729             pko_status.s.dqstatus = PKO_DQSTATUS_NOFPABUF;
00730             return pko_status;
00731         }
00732     } else {
00733         cvmx_atomic_add32_nosync( &(pParam->depth), 1);
00734     }
00735 
00736     if (CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00737         /* Request one return word */
00738         pko_send_dma_data.s.rtnlen = 1;
00739     } else {
00740         /* Do not expect a return word */
00741         pko_send_dma_data.s.rtnlen = 0;
00742     }
00743 
00744     /* build store data for DMA */
00745     pko_send_dma_data.s.scraddr = scr_off >> 3;
00746     pko_send_dma_data.s.did = 0x51;
00747     pko_send_dma_data.s.node = node;
00748     pko_send_dma_data.s.dqop = dqop;
00749     pko_send_dma_data.s.dq = dq;
00750 
00751     /* Wait to finish tag switch just before issueing LMTDMA */
00752     if (tag_wait)
00753         cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
00754 
00755     /* issue PKO DMA */
00756     cvmx_write64_uint64(dma_addr, pko_send_dma_data.u64);
00757 
00758     if (cvmx_unlikely(pko_send_dma_data.s.rtnlen)) {
00759         /* Wait for LMTDMA completion */
00760         CVMX_SYNCIOBDMA;
00761 
00762         /* Retreive real result */
00763         pko_status.u64 = cvmx_scratch_read64(scr_off);
00764         pParam->depth = pko_status.s.depth;
00765     } else {
00766         /* Fake positive result */
00767         pko_status.s.dqop = dqop;
00768         pko_status.s.dqstatus = PKO_DQSTATUS_PASS;
00769     }
00770 
00771     return pko_status;
00772 }
00773 
00774 
00775 /*
00776  * @INTERNAL
00777  * Sends PKO descriptor commands via CVMSEG LM and LMTDMA.
00778  * @param node is the destination node
00779  * @param dq is the destonation descriptor queue.
00780  * @param cmds[] is an array of 64-bit PKO3 headers/subheaders
00781  * @param numworkds is the number of outgoing words
00782  * @param dqop is the operation code
00783  * @return the PKO3 native query result structure.
00784  *
00785  * <numwords> must be between 1 and 15 for CVMX_PKO_DQ_SEND command
00786  * otherwise it must be 0.
00787  *
00788  * NOTE: Internal use only.
00789  */
00790 static inline cvmx_pko_query_rtn_t
00791 __cvmx_pko3_do_dma(uint8_t node, uint16_t dq, uint64_t cmds[],
00792     unsigned numwords, enum cvmx_pko_dqop dqop)
00793 {
00794     const unsigned scr_base = CVMX_PKO_LMTLINE * CVMX_CACHE_LINE_SIZE;
00795     cvmx_pko_query_rtn_t pko_status;
00796     cvmx_pko_lmtdma_data_t pko_send_dma_data;
00797     uint64_t dma_addr;
00798     unsigned i, scr_off;
00799     cvmx_pko3_dq_params_t *pParam;
00800 
00801     pParam = cvmx_pko3_dq_parameters(node, dq);
00802     CVMX_PREFETCH0(pParam);
00803     /* Push WB */
00804     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00805 
00806     pko_status.u64 = 0;
00807     pko_send_dma_data.u64 = 0;
00808 
00809     if (cvmx_unlikely(numwords > 15)) {
00810         cvmx_dprintf("%s: ERROR: Internal error\n",
00811                 __FUNCTION__);
00812         pko_status.u64 = ~0ull;
00813         return pko_status;
00814     }
00815 
00816     /* Store the command words into CVMSEG LM */
00817     for(i = 0, scr_off = scr_base; i < numwords; i++) {
00818         cvmx_scratch_write64(scr_off, cmds[i]);
00819         scr_off += sizeof(cmds[0]);
00820     }
00821 
00822     /* With 0 data to send, this is an IOBDMA, else LMTDMA operation */
00823     if(numwords == 0) {
00824         dma_addr = CVMX_IOBDMA_ORDERED_IO_ADDR;
00825     } else {
00826         /* LMTDMA address offset is (nWords-1) */
00827         dma_addr = CVMX_LMTDMA_ORDERED_IO_ADDR;
00828         dma_addr += (numwords - 1) << 3;
00829     }
00830 
00831     if (cvmx_likely(dqop == CVMX_PKO_DQ_SEND)) {
00832         if (cvmx_unlikely(pParam->depth > pParam->limit)) {
00833             cvmx_pko_dqx_wm_cnt_t wm_cnt;
00834             wm_cnt.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node,
00835                 CVMX_PKO_DQX_WM_CNT(dq));
00836             pParam->depth = pko_status.s.depth = wm_cnt.s.count;
00837         }
00838 
00839         if (cvmx_unlikely(pParam->depth > pParam->limit)) {
00840             pko_status.s.dqop = dqop;
00841             pko_status.s.dqstatus = PKO_DQSTATUS_NOFPABUF;
00842             return pko_status;
00843         } else {
00844             cvmx_atomic_add32_nosync( &(pParam->depth), 1);
00845         }
00846     }
00847 
00848     if (cvmx_unlikely(dqop != CVMX_PKO_DQ_SEND) ||
00849         CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING) {
00850         /* Request one return word */
00851         pko_send_dma_data.s.rtnlen = 1;
00852         /* Write all-ones into the return area */
00853         cvmx_scratch_write64(scr_off, ~0ull);
00854     } else {
00855         /* Do not expext a return word */
00856         pko_send_dma_data.s.rtnlen = 0;
00857     }
00858 
00859     /* build store data for DMA */
00860     pko_send_dma_data.s.scraddr = scr_off >> 3;
00861     pko_send_dma_data.s.did = 0x51;
00862     pko_send_dma_data.s.node = node;
00863     pko_send_dma_data.s.dqop = dqop;
00864     pko_send_dma_data.s.dq = dq;
00865 
00866     /* Barrier: make sure all prior writes complete before the following */
00867     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00868 
00869     /* Wait to finish tag switch just before issueing LMTDMA */
00870     cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
00871 
00872     /* issue PKO DMA */
00873     cvmx_write64_uint64(dma_addr, pko_send_dma_data.u64);
00874 
00875     if (pko_send_dma_data.s.rtnlen) {
00876         /* Wait LMTDMA for completion */
00877         CVMX_SYNCIOBDMA;
00878 
00879         /* Retreive real result */
00880         pko_status.u64 = cvmx_scratch_read64(scr_off);
00881         pParam->depth = pko_status.s.depth;
00882     } else {
00883         /* Fake positive result */
00884         pko_status.s.dqop = dqop;
00885         pko_status.s.dqstatus = PKO_DQSTATUS_PASS;
00886     }
00887 
00888     return pko_status;
00889 }
00890 
00891 
00892 /*
00893  * Transmit packets through PKO, simplified API
00894  *
00895  * @INTERNAL
00896  *
00897  * @param dq is a global destination queue number
00898  * @param pki_ptr specifies packet first linked pointer as returned from
00899  * 'cvmx_wqe_get_pki_pkt_ptr()'.
00900  * @param len is the total number of bytes in the packet.
00901  * @param gaura is the aura to free packet buffers after trasnmit.
00902  * @param pCounter is an address of a 64-bit counter to atomically
00903  * @param ptag is a Flow Tag pointer for packet odering or NULL
00904  * decrement when packet transmission is complete.
00905  *
00906  * @return returns 0 if successful and -1 on failure.
00907  *
00908  *
00909  * NOTE: This is a provisional API, and is subject to change.
00910  */
00911 static inline int
00912 cvmx_pko3_xmit_link_buf(int dq,cvmx_buf_ptr_pki_t pki_ptr,
00913     unsigned len, int gaura, uint64_t *pCounter, uint32_t *ptag)
00914 {
00915     cvmx_pko_query_rtn_t pko_status;
00916     cvmx_pko_send_hdr_t hdr_s;
00917     cvmx_pko_buf_ptr_t gtr_s;
00918     unsigned node, nwords;
00919     unsigned scr_base = cvmx_pko3_lmtdma_scr_base();
00920 
00921     /* Separate global DQ# into node and local DQ */
00922     node = dq >> 10;
00923     dq &= (1 << 10)-1;
00924 
00925     /* Fill in header */
00926     hdr_s.u64 = 0;
00927     hdr_s.s.total = len;
00928     hdr_s.s.df = (gaura < 0);
00929     hdr_s.s.ii = 1;
00930     hdr_s.s.aura = (gaura >= 0)? gaura: 0;
00931 #ifdef __LITTLE_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00932     hdr_s.s.le = 1;
00933     cvmx_wqe_pko_errata_22235(pki_ptr, len);
00934 #endif
00935 
00936     /* Fill in gather */
00937     gtr_s.u64 = 0;
00938     gtr_s.s.subdc3 = CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_LINK;
00939     gtr_s.s.addr = pki_ptr.addr;
00940     gtr_s.s.size = pki_ptr.size;
00941 
00942     /* Setup command word pointers */
00943     cvmx_scratch_write64(scr_base+sizeof(uint64_t)*0, hdr_s.u64);
00944     cvmx_scratch_write64(scr_base+sizeof(uint64_t)*1, gtr_s.u64);
00945     nwords = 2;
00946 
00947     /* Conditionally setup an atomic decrement counter */
00948     if (pCounter != NULL) {
00949         cvmx_pko_send_mem_t mem_s;
00950         mem_s.s.subdc4 = CVMX_PKO_SENDSUBDC_MEM;
00951         mem_s.s.dsz = MEMDSZ_B64;
00952         mem_s.s.alg = MEMALG_SUB;
00953         mem_s.s.offset = 1;
00954         mem_s.s.wmem = 0;
00955         mem_s.s.addr = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(CASTPTR(void,pCounter));
00956         cvmx_scratch_write64(
00957             scr_base + sizeof(uint64_t) * nwords++,
00958             mem_s.u64);
00959     }
00960 
00961     /* To preserve packet order, go atomic with DQ-specific tag */
00962     if (ptag != NULL)
00963         cvmx_pow_tag_sw(*ptag ^ dq, CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_ATOMIC);
00964  
00965     /* Do LMTDMA */
00966     pko_status = __cvmx_pko3_lmtdma(node, dq, nwords, ptag != NULL);
00967 
00968     if (cvmx_likely(pko_status.s.dqstatus == PKO_DQSTATUS_PASS))
00969         return 0;
00970     else
00971         return -1;
00972 }
00973 
00974 /**
00975  * @INTERNAL
00976  *
00977  * Retreive PKO internal AURA from register.
00978  */
00979 static inline unsigned __cvmx_pko3_aura_get(unsigned node)
00980 {
00981     static int16_t aura = -1;
00982     cvmx_pko_dpfi_fpa_aura_t pko_aura;
00983 
00984     if (aura >= 0)
00985         return aura;
00986 
00987     pko_aura.u64 = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, CVMX_PKO_DPFI_FPA_AURA);
00988 
00989     aura =  (pko_aura.s.node << 10) | pko_aura.s.laura;
00990     return aura;
00991 }
00992 
00993  /** Open configured descriptor queues before queueing packets into them.
00994  *
00995  * @param node is to specify the node to which this configuration is applied.
00996  * @param dq is the descriptor queue number to be opened.
00997  * @return returns 0 on sucess or -1 on failure.
00998  */
00999 int cvmx_pko_dq_open(int node, int dq);
01000 
01001  /** Close a descriptor queue
01002  *
01003  * @param node is to specify the node to which this configuration is applied.
01004  * @param dq is the descriptor queue number to be opened.
01005  * @return returns 0 on sucess or -1 on failure.
01006  *
01007  * This should be called before changing the DQ parent link, topology,
01008  * or when shutting down the PKO.
01009  */
01010 int cvmx_pko3_dq_close(int node, int dq);
01011 
01012  /** Query a descriptor queue
01013  *
01014  * @param node is to specify the node to which this configuration is applied.
01015  * @param dq is the descriptor queue number to be opened.
01016  * @return returns the descriptor queue depth on sucess or -1 on failure.
01017  *
01018  * This should be called before changing the DQ parent link, topology,
01019  * or when shutting down the PKO.
01020  */
01021 int cvmx_pko3_dq_query(int node, int dq);
01022 
01023 /** Drain a descriptor queue
01024  *
01025  * Before closing a DQ, this call will drain all pending traffic
01026  * on the DQ to the NULL MAC, which will circumvent any traffic
01027  * shaping and flow control to quickly reclaim all packet buffers.
01028  */
01029 void cvmx_pko3_dq_drain(int node, int dq);
01030 
01031 /*
01032  * PKO global intialization for 78XX.
01033  *
01034  * @param node is the node on which PKO block is initialized.
01035  * @param aura is the 12-bit AURA (including node) for PKO internal use.
01036  * @return none.
01037  */
01038 int cvmx_pko3_hw_init_global(int node, uint16_t aura);
01039 
01040 /**
01041  * Shutdown the entire PKO
01042  */
01043 int cvmx_pko3_hw_disable(int node);
01044 
01045 
01046 /* Define legacy type here to break circular dependency */
01047 typedef struct cvmx_pko_port_status cvmx_pko_port_status_t;
01048 
01049 /**
01050  * @INTERNAL
01051  * Backward compatibility for collecting statistics from PKO3
01052  *
01053  */
01054 extern void cvmx_pko3_get_legacy_port_stats(uint16_t ipd_port,
01055     unsigned clear, cvmx_pko_port_status_t * status);
01056 
01057 /** Set MAC options
01058  *
01059  * The options supported are the parameters below:
01060  *
01061  * @param xiface The physical interface number
01062  * @param index The physical sub-interface port
01063  * @param fcs_enable Enable FCS generation
01064  * @param pad_enable Enable padding to minimum packet size
01065  * @param fcs_sop_off Number of bytes at start of packet to exclude from FCS
01066  *
01067  * The typical use for `fcs_sop_off` is when the interface is configured
01068  * to use a header such as HighGig to precede every Ethernet packet,
01069  * such a header usually does not partake in the CRC32 computation stream,
01070  * and its size must be set with this parameter.
01071  *
01072  * @return Returns 0 on success, -1 if interface/port is invalid.
01073  */
01074 extern int cvmx_pko3_interface_options(int xiface, int index,
01075             bool fcs_enable, bool pad_enable,
01076             unsigned fcs_sop_off);
01077 
01078 /** Set Descriptor Queue options
01079  *
01080  * The `min_pad` parameter must be in agreement with the interface-level
01081  * padding option for all descriptor queues assigned to that particular
01082  * interface/port.
01083  */
01084 extern void cvmx_pko3_dq_options(unsigned node, unsigned dq, bool min_pad);
01085 
01086 extern int cvmx_pko3_port_fifo_size(unsigned int xiface, unsigned index);
01087 extern int cvmx_pko3_channel_credit_level(int node,
01088     enum cvmx_pko3_level_e level);
01089 extern int cvmx_pko3_port_xoff(unsigned int xiface, unsigned index);
01090 extern int cvmx_pko3_port_xon(unsigned int xiface, unsigned index);
01091 
01092 /* Packet descriptor - PKO3 command buffer + internal state */
01093 typedef struct cvmx_pko3_pdesc_s {
01094     uint64_t *jump_buf; /**< jump buffer vaddr */
01095     int16_t last_aura;  /**< AURA of the latest LINK_S/GATHER_S */
01096     unsigned
01097         num_words:5,    /**< valid words in word array 2..16 */
01098         headroom:10,    /**< free bytes at start of 1st buf */
01099         hdr_offsets:1,
01100         pki_word4_present : 1;
01101     /* PKO3 command buffer: */
01102     cvmx_pko_send_hdr_t *hdr_s;
01103     uint64_t word[16];  /**< header and subcommands buffer */
01104     /* Bookkeeping fields: */
01105     uint64_t send_work_s;   /**< SEND_WORK_S must be the very last subdc */
01106     int16_t jb_aura;    /**< AURA where the jump buffer belongs */
01107     uint16_t mem_s_ix;  /**< index of first MEM_S subcommand */
01108     uint8_t ckl4_alg;   /**< L3/L4 alg to use if recalc is needed */
01109     /* Fields saved from WQE for later inspection */
01110     cvmx_pki_wqe_word4_t pki_word4;
01111     cvmx_pki_wqe_word2_t pki_word2;
01112 } cvmx_pko3_pdesc_t;
01113

01115 int cvmx_pko3_pdesc_from_wqe(cvmx_pko3_pdesc_t *pdesc, cvmx_wqe_78xx_t *wqe,
01116     bool free_bufs);
01117 int cvmx_pko3_pdesc_transmit(cvmx_pko3_pdesc_t *pdesc, uint16_t dq,
01118     uint32_t *flow_tag);
01119 int cvmx_pko3_pdesc_notify_decrement(cvmx_pko3_pdesc_t *pdesc,
01120         volatile uint64_t *p_counter);
01121 int cvmx_pko3_pdesc_notify_wqe(cvmx_pko3_pdesc_t *pdesc, cvmx_wqe_78xx_t *wqe,
01122     uint8_t node, uint8_t group, uint8_t tt, uint32_t tag);
01123 int cvmx_pko3_pdesc_buf_append(cvmx_pko3_pdesc_t *pdesc, void *p_data,
01124         unsigned data_bytes, unsigned gaura);
01125 int cvmx_pko3_pdesc_append_free(cvmx_pko3_pdesc_t *pdesc, uint64_t addr,
01126                 unsigned gaura);
01127 int cvmx_pko3_pdesc_hdr_push(cvmx_pko3_pdesc_t *pdesc,
01128     const void *p_data, uint8_t data_bytes, uint8_t layer);
01129 int cvmx_pko3_pdesc_hdr_pop(cvmx_pko3_pdesc_t *pdesc,
01130         void *hdr_buf, unsigned num_bytes);
01131 int cvmx_pko3_pdesc_hdr_peek(cvmx_pko3_pdesc_t *pdesc,
01132         void *hdr_buf, unsigned num_bytes, unsigned offset);
01133 void cvmx_pko3_pdesc_set_free(cvmx_pko3_pdesc_t *pdesc, bool free_bufs);
